summary: This is a guide with screenshots on how to fix deleted NavMeshes
descriptionHtml:
I decided to make a small guide in which I explain how to fix deleted NavMeshes made by mods.

This method is useful for fixing "merged navmesh islands", which cause a deleted navmeshes.

There are some simpler ways to fix other causes of deleted navmeshes, which can be found here:

[url=https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3337-skyrim-fixing-navmesh-deletion-using-tes5edit/]- https://afkmods.iguanadons.net/index.php?/topic/3337-skyrim-fixing-navmesh-deletion-using-tes5edit/[/url]

A video about it:

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q-ZQtgveKaM]- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q-ZQtgveKaM[/url]

Also, the following guide is very useful to check whether one of the plugins in your load order has any deleted navmeshes, by creating a filter in xEdit:

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=babuNn5pzsw]- https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=babuNn5pzsw[/url]

Note: Do NOT use any of these methods to clean the deleted navmeshes in the official ESMs, this will do more harm than good. By official ESMs, I mean Skyrim.esm, Update.esm, Dawnguard.esm, HearthFires.esm and Dragonborn.esm.

If you have any questions, feel free to ask them!

[b][color=#93c47d][size=5]Credits[/size][/color][/b]

Elminster, Sharlikran, Zilav, and Hlp.Â - For [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5Edit[/url] (xEdit)

Bethesda - For Skyrim and the CK

soupdragon - For his youtube videos on this topic

Arthmoor - For his guide on afkmods to fix NavMeshes in an easier and faster way.

The entire modding community - for being awesome <3
author: AndrealphusVIII
